Our infrastructure is collapsing. Teachers are underpaid. Veterans sleep on the streets. Families can't afford child care.

But, according to my Republican colleagues, one of our highest priorities must be to give hundreds of billions of dollars to a few billionaire families.

This week I conducted my first-ever line of questioning at an Oversight committee hearing, which focused on the skyrocketing costs of pharmaceuticals.

Here’s what happened ⬇️ https://twitter.com/ssworks/status/1091079715572592640 QT @SSWorks The public is acting as early investor, putting tons of money in the development of drugs that then become privatized.

Our bill only applies to the richest 0.2% of Americans. It would establish a:

-45% tax on estate values $3.5M to $10M
-50% tax on estate values $10M to $50M
-55% tax on estate values over $50M
-77% tax on estate values over $1 billion
We’re doing this for our children’s future. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DySXLMmXcAIJZ9g.jpg

The LIFT Act will help lift nine million Americans out of poverty.
